intro: Flagenium setosum, commonly known as the bristly flagellum, is a flowering plant characterized by its unique, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine, stiff hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in early spring and are followed by small, dry fruits.
